intro: Mertensia coriacea var. dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf bluebell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture, and its stems are often covered in fine, white pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a valuable addition to woodland gardens. Its botanical features make it an attractive and ecologically significant plant in native plant landscapes.
